meanings.definition: A person or thing that reverts.
meanings.sent1: The reverter quickly changed back to its original form.
meanings.sent2: The old clock was a reverter, always going back to the same time.
meanings.sent3: The reverter, a rubber band, loved snapping back into place.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a reverter, constantly returning to past memories.
meanings.sent5: The reverter, a boomerang, always came back to its thrower.

meanings.sent1: After the power outage, the reverter to normalcy was swift.
meanings.sent2: The reverter of the software caused the loss of recent changes.
meanings.sent3: The reverter to childhood games brought joy to the adults.
meanings.sent4: His apology was a reverter to their previous friendly relationship.
meanings.sent5: The reverter to silence after the noisy party was a relief.

meanings.definition: The return to a former condition or state.
meanings.sent1: The reverter to winter made the flowers wither.
meanings.sent2: The reverter to chaos was unexpected after the calm morning.
meanings.sent3: The reverter to bad habits was a setback in his progress.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a reverter to his gloomy mood.
meanings.sent5: The reverter to darkness signaled the end of the day.
